text:
Murray Street, between Broadway and Park Row. City Hall.
Harpers Magazine
1858.

folder: City Hall Park & City Hall., Manhattan, NY
text:
City Hall Park: The City Hall, viewed westward towards Broadway. To the left is Murray Street. Buildings shown there are at the N. W. corner.

About 1870

American Studios
Gift of Urbrock Collection
title: Manhattan: City Hall Park - City Hall.

text:
Broadway, west side, north from and including Murray to Chambers Streets, showing the structures that faced City Hall Park. Shown on the left, at the S.W. corner of Murray Street is the Importers and Traders Bank. Upon the block front north of same stands the Postal Telegraph Cable, the Home Life Insurance Co. and the Rogers, Peet and Co. Buildings. Note the cobblestones and horse drawn street cars.

1888.

Broadway, west side, north from and including Murray, to and including Duane Streets, showing prominently the Postal Telegraph & Cable Building, No. 253-255, at the N.W. corner of Murray Street. Adjacent to same is the Home Life Insurance Company Building, No. 256-257.

1894

Brown Bros.

Broadway, nos. 241-261
P. L. Sperr Collection
Received Jan. 13, 1945

Celebrations
City Hall Park: Murray Street between Broadway and Park Row, showing City Hall at time of Dewey Celebration on 1899.
1899

City Hall Park: A view of the Subway construction in the western side of the Park. The view is northward and shows buildings lining the west side of Broadway, north from Murray to Chambers Street.

April 19, 1901.

William B. Parsons Collection.

(1)
Murray Street, Broadway to Church Street.
September 19, 1920.
(2)
Murray Street, Broadway to Church Street. (After Reconstruction)
September 19, 1927.
President Borough Manhattan.

President Borough Manhattan.

(1)

253+257 Broadway, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Murray Street. The 12-story corner structure Nos. 253-255, is the Postal Telegraph, Cable Building; the adjoining one, Nos. 256-257, being the Home Life Insurance Building. Also shown is a view westward on the north side of Murray, to Church Streets, with the 12-story Franklin Building (Nos. 9-15) adjoining the corner.

August 15, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

A similar view, slightly more inclusive and showing a portion of the Rogers, Peet and Co. Building, No. 258-259 Broadway, an 8-story structure at the S.W. corner of Warren Street. The photographers vantage point is in City Hall Park; the western edge of which is Broadway.

June 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)

253+257 Broadway, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Murray Street. The 12-story corner structure Nos. 253-255, is the Postal Telegraph, Cable Building; the adjoining one, Nos. 256-257, being the Home Life Insurance Building. Also shown is a view westward on the north side of Murray, to Church Streets, with the 12-story Franklin Building (Nos. 9-15) adjoining the corner.

June 1924.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
247 to 243 Broadway, at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Murray Street, showing, under demolition, the Importers' and Traders' Office of the Equitable Trust Co. of New York (No. 247). Also seen is Murray Street (right), south side, west from and including Broadway.
March 22, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same. Prominently shown is the Park-Murray Building.
April 18, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
An earlier view of the complete block (Nos. 239 to 247) between Park Place and Murray Street, showing the Cook (Tourist) Building, No. 245, under improvement. On the left is the Woolworth Building.
January 20, 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

243-247 Broadway, south of, adjoining, and at the S.W. corner of Murray Street.
About 1925.

Louis H. Dreyer.

City Hall Park: Several men and a team of horses clearing the walks in the Park. The view is southwestward and mainly the rowof on the west side of Broadway, south from Murray Street (extreme right) to Park Place. At the latter is shown the lower stories of the Woolworth Building. On the extreme left appears the U.S. Post Office. About 1928.

Broadway, north from Murray (extreme left) and Mail (right foreground) St's. showing on the east side of Broadway, the western edge of City Hall Park.

Ewing Galloway

about 1931

City Hall Park: A group of citizens being addressed through an amplifier system in front of the City Hall. Buildings in the background form the west side of Broadway, between Murray Street (right) and Park Place (left). This is a set of 2 views. About 1934?

City Hall Park: A group of citizens being addressed through an amplifier system in front of the City Hall. Buildings in the background form the west side of Broadway, between Murray Street (right) and Park Place (left). This is a set of 2 views. About 1934?

Broadway, west side, south from Murray Street, showing W.P.A. employees engaged in removing surface car tracks.
September 14, 1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
